result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey R. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Prison sentence now serving.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey R. Peterson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3:48  Defendant Corey R. Peterson in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich - Plead to the count in the complaint.  90 days jail sentence.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  Defendant pleads no contest to the charge.   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty  Court orders 90 days jail concurrent to the prison sentence now serving.

ADDRESS INFO for Corey R. Peterson
Current: 2000 Progress Drive, New Lisbon, WI 53950 United States  (Effective: 09-22-2015)
Prior: PO Box 244, Amery, WI 54001

Defendant Corey R. Peterson in Court with Attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 4:35 p.m.  Court advises of charges, possible penalties and rights.  DF understands and waives further reading.  Atty. Chapman enters a NG plea.  State requests $100 cash bond, no objection.  Atty. Chapman advises re: prison and believes case can be resolved, requests plea date set soon.  Court advises Defendant of bond conditions.  Court questions address and confirms dob.  Court confirms non-military.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff. (Signed by Judge Boles on September 11, 2015. Copy. Original to New Lisbon Correctional Institution)
